Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew C Dort was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain FTE/schooling or combination.

No contact with victim, A.L.L. 

No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior approval and approved chaperone.  

No alcohol or drug use.  No use of computers or internet including smart phones.

Register and remain in compliance with Sex Offender Registry for life.  

Enroll in and successfully cmoplete any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate.  

DNA sample.

Case Called: 1:58 pm
INCLUDES 15CF1140, 15CF1139.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty John Bachman.
VRCW. Parties state changes to be made to the PSI.
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS:
15CF1140:
Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child)>> 18 Years WSPS, 9 Years IC and 9 Years ES, Concurrent to each other and any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: No Contact with Victim A.L.L. and No Contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior approval and approved chaperone, Register and remain in compliance with Sex Offender Registry for life, No Alcohol or Drug Use, No use of computers or internet including smart phones, Obtain and Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Enroll in and successfully complete any Assessment/treatment/counseling programs as directed, Pay all court obligations, Supervision Fees, and any other Fees/Fines to be paid, Restitution in the amount of $2,878 to be paid to BMO and $200 to K.S.. Defendant is not eligible for Programming. Court finds 415 days credit.

Ct. 2 (Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime)>> 18 Years WSPS, 9 Years IC and 9 Years ES, Concurrent to each other and any sentence currently being served. CONDITIONS: No Contact with Victim A.L.L. and No Contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior approval and approved chaperone, Register and remain in compliance with Sex Offender Registry for life, No Alcohol or Drug Use, No use of computers or internet including smart phones, Obtain and Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination, Enroll in and successfully complete any Assessment/treatment/counseling programs as directed, Pay all court obligations, Supervision Fees, and any other Fees/Fines to be paid, Restitution in the amount of $2,870 to be paid to BMO and $200 to K.S.. Defendant is not eligible for Programming. Court finds 415 days credit.

PSI TO BE SEALED.
LETTERS TO BE SEALED.

records.addlTxt: Recusal

Includes 15CF1139 and 15CF1140.    No contact with BMO Harris Bank, K.S., A.L.  No contact with any females under 18 years of age except children by phone or writing.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No use of computers/internet.
